result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikki L Putchel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank and pay all appropriate costs while on probation on case 16CF2181.
__________________\
Pursuant to 973.015 Court finds the defenant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence. ?Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law upon completion of probation on case 16CF2181, upon submission of motion.  Expungement is not contingent upon payment of costs or fees.

records.addlTxt: Completion of Representation

Defendant Nikki L Putchel in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Nikki L Putchel in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve FIFTY (50) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FIFTY (50) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs WHILE ON PROBATION ON CASE 16CF2181.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law UPON COMPLETION OF PROBATION ON CASE 16CF2181, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Nikki L Putchel in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Nikki L Putchel in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

TURNOVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR PLACEMENT.  UPON PLACEMENT BAIL TO REVERT TO $250.00 PR BOND.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson for Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Defendant Nikki L Putchel in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Nikki L Putchel in custody.  Gilbert Fielding Urfer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ORIGINAL COURT FILE IS UNAVAILABLE - COURT RECORD ENTRY IS MADE IN A DUPLICATE FILE.

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is in treatment.  COURT WAIVED DEFENDANT'S APPEARANCE FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS HEARING.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  IF DEFENDANT IS IN TREATMENT COURT MAY WAIVE HER APPEARANCE AT THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nikki L Putchel in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Nikki L Putchel in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  case was Staffed in Chambers.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant is awaiting Placement.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  IF DEFENDANT IS IN TREATMENT COURT MAY WAIVE HER APPEARANCE AT THE NEXT DATE.  Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
TURNOVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR PLACEMENT.  UPON PLACEMENT BAIL TO REVERT TO $250.00 PR BOND.

Defendant Nikki L Putchel in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  case was Staffed in Chambers.  Matter before the Court to address JusticePoint Violation.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that TWO (2) WEEKS ago she started IOP.  Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER to JusticePoint for Placement.  Upon Placement, bail to revert to $250.00 PR BOND.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nikki L Putchel in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33. Case calendared for review hearing on 12/06/2016 at 01:30 pm, Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant failed to appear as defendant is in treatment per defense counsel. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing hearing o n 09-20-2016 at 1:30 pm, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nikki L Putchel in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Jennifer Tate appeared on behalf of Paul Michael Hauer for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense request an adjournment. Defendant is still awaiting possible deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant is on the waiting list for Justice Point. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 09-02-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Court advises if the case is not resolved at the next proceeding the misdemeanor case will be sent back to misdemeanor courts to be resolved.

Court addresses the Justice Point Violation report received on 07-28-2016. 
The Court REITERATES conditions of bail. Any future positive drug tests or violations may result in higher cash bail or bail forfeiture.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nikki L Putchel in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court ordered stayed warrant withdrawn. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea/possible dpa in Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. For reasons stated on the record,   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Calendar call scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nikki L Putchel in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Nikki L Putchel in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rifelj, Branch 31.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Nikki L Putchel not in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-31-2015 at 1:30pm
